Tucson growls back at Drill Bit with a snarl.

" Just focus on what you're =
doing and mind your own business. "

He tries very hard to keep his composu=
re but it was difficult to resist the temptation of snapping Drill bit to s=
mitherines.

Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for thing=
s you already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.

On D=
ec 28, 2011, at 2:21 AM, "adamsafran" <adamsafran@...> wrote:

> 
> >=
 
> > BIG CONVOY frowned mightily as he listened to DRILLBIT as well as
> >=
 TUSCON, his optics going from one to the other. "There is only one way
> >=
 to resolve this." CONVOY said as he looked coolly at DRILLBIT.
> > 
> > "I=
f there is an answer it lies with Leo Prime and he is above us."
> > Turnin=
g to go up the tunnel began to march upward, MACH KICK and BREAK
> > follow=
ing, the trip upwards far more difficult as the ground sloped up
> > sharpl=
y.
> > 
> > Ahead of them, echoing down the hall the voices, especially LEO=
 PRIME
> > and the others could be dimly heard, they were perhaps several h=
undred
> > meters away, although in these tunnels sound seemed to travel fa=
rther.
> > 
> > Yes it was time to meet.
> > 
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> There was an =
amused glance over at the roaring TUSCON, and DRILL BIt murmured, "Really, =
Maximal, you should have been a Predacon. You acn't go half a breem without=
 screaming at someone.." Audible only to those paying -close- attention giv=
en all of the yelling going around at hte moment.
> 
> Listening as the MAX=
IMALS came down the hole, DRILL BIT, not yet aware of the slamming trap up =
top, whispered, "Right ons chedule."
> 
> Then as the MAXIMALS and possibly=
 teh PREDACONS were coming on down, went to transform and then dig away und=
erground to lie in wait anew.
> 
> 

--Apple-Mail-1686486A-5BFE-4D01-841D-C6D065A0BD58

      <p><br>
> <br>
> BIG CONVOY frowned might=
ily as he listened to DRILLBIT as well as<br>
> TUSCON, his optics going=
 from one to the other. "There is only one way<br>
> to resolve this." C=
ONVOY said as he looked coolly at DRILLBIT.<br>
> <br>
> "If there is=
 an answer it lies with Leo Prime and he is above us."<br>
> Turning to =
go up the tunnel began to march upward, MACH KICK and BREAK<br>
> follow=
ing, the trip upwards far more difficult as the ground sloped up<br>
> s=
harply.<br>
> <br>
> Ahead of them, echoing down the hall the voices,=
 especially LEO PRIME<br>
> and the others could be dimly heard, they we=
re perhaps several hundred<br>
> meters away, although in these tunnels =
sound seemed to travel farther.<br>
> <br>
> Yes it was time to meet.=
<br>
> <br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
There was an amused glance over at=
 the roaring TUSCON, and DRILL BIt murmured, "Really, Maximal, you should h=
ave been a Predacon.  You acn't go half a breem without screaming at someon=
e.."  Audible only to those paying -close- attention given all of the yelli=
ng going around at hte moment.<br>
<br>
Listening as the MAXIMALS came down=
 the hole, DRILL BIT, not yet aware of the slamming trap up top, whispered,=
 "Right ons chedule."<br>
<br>
Then as the MAXIMALS and possibly teh PREDAC=
ONS were coming on down, went to transform and then dig away underground to=
 lie in wait anew.<br>
<br>
</p>
